thread.title: Kyrgyzstan Election Expected to Favor Pro-Russian Parties
thread.title_full: Kyrgyzstan Election Expected to Favor Pro-Russian Parties

title: Kyrgyzstan Election Expected to Favor Pro-Russian Parties
text:
Kyrgyzstan Election Expected to Favor Pro-Russian Parties 
Technology Industry News.Net : Sunday 4th October, 2015 
Kyrgyzstan holds parliamentary elections Sunday, with voters expected to give pro-Russian parties a new five-year mandate. 
There were long lines of voters at polling stations across the majority-Muslim central Asian nation of 6 million people. More than 2,000 candidates from 14 parties were vying for 120 seats in parliament. 
The party linked to pro-Russian President Almazbek Atambayev, the Social Democratic Party of Kyrgyzstan, is expected to do well in the voting, as are three other parties loyal to Moscow. 
Atambayev has forged close ties with Russian President Vladimir Putin, with Moscow maintaining an air base in Kyrgyzstan and forgiving loans it has made to the government in Bishkek. 
The United States last year closed an air base it had in Kyrgyzstan that had served as a launching ground for U.S. operations in Afghanistan since 2001. 
After voting, Atambayev praised the country's democratic elections, saying, "I remember previous years, when conducting genuinely honest elections was just a dream." 
Atambayev was elected as Kyrgyzstan's head of state in 2011 after political volatility led to the ouster of two presidents in popular uprisings in 2005 and 2010. More Technology Industry News   'immoral' tactics
